message:
Yes, but I highly recommend that you register those tasks with the ASP.NET runtime. More info:  
[http://blog.stephencleary.c...](http://blog.stephencleary.com/2012/12/returning-early-from-aspnet-requests.html "http://blog.stephencleary.com/2012/12/returning-early-from-aspnet-requests.html")  
[http://blog.stephencleary.c...](http://blog.stephencleary.com/2014/06/fire-and-forget-on-asp-net.html "http://blog.stephencleary.com/2014/06/fire-and-forget-on-asp-net.html")

My AspNetBackgroundTasks library ([https://github.com/StephenC...](https://github.com/StephenCleary/AspNetBackgroundTasks) "https://github.com/StephenCleary/AspNetBackgroundTasks)") uses Task.Run internally but also registers them with the ASP.NET runtime.
